summary: The documents pertain to the creation and dissemination of an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray in April 1968, shortly after the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. The composite was requested by Richard Ober of CI/OP/DO and constructed using a specific code prior to the arrival of photographs. The documents highlight specific details provided for the composite, such as the omission of a forehead scar due to an unknown location and the protrusion of Ray's left ear more than his right. The composite was intended for dissemination and use in identifying and locating James Earl Ray.
significance: The Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray was a crucial tool in the effort to identify and apprehend him following the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. The documents detail the process of creating and disseminating this composite, highlighting the urgency and specific details considered important for its accuracy. The composite played a significant role in the investigation and subsequent pursuit of James Earl Ray.
